I get motion sickness easily.. don’t take the chance and give them Bonine or Dramamine, A pill you can get from any drug store (US) to prevent motion sickness.
Day to day
What time if the year are you going ?

Ask for Xamamina in the pharmacy, amazing against sea sickness and also available for kids. We’ve just returned to Naples from Ischia in very rough wind/sea conditions and all 4 of us slept the whole time 😆
The ferry from Capri to Sorrento was extremely rough. Take bonine. Works great!
My daughter gets sea sick. She used those sea sick bands and did not get sick at all

Guess it depends on the day and the boat. In July six of us went from Maples to Amalfi and then to Positano by “fast” ferry. Not once did we experience any other than a very smooth ride. No one felt any queasiness or other affect.

text:
Hi everyone!

This is my first time dealing with delayed luggage and I’d like some insight/advice. I had a flight from Santorini to Rome earlier this week with a quick layover in Thessaloniki. I had to check my suitcase in and it was supposed to go straight to Rome.

We got to the baggage claim in Fiumicino Airport and the airline sent an email stating that my suitcase never made it to the destination, and to fill out a form for the tracing process. I do have an AirTag in my bag and I could see that it was in Thessaloniki still. My friend’s bag made it but not mine.

The next day I got a text from the airline that said they found my bag and to expect a call to arrange delivery method. Two days later, I received an email at 11pm from the lost & found at Fiumicino Airport that they found my bag but don’t have any information otherwise.

I asked if it was possible to receive my bag in Rome since we were leaving for Cinque Terre the following morning. They replied that the courier wouldn’t make it in time and asked if I could come back and collect (and that their office was open at 7:30am). I was unable to make this happen since we had a train to catch and replied as such.

Since we settled in Cinque Terre, I’ve attempted to reach out again but there is no response. I’ve emailed and called the number provided numerous times. All I get is a busy tone or “all our operators are currently busy”.

Sorry this is a long post but I’m just really lost and unsure what to do. 😞 We have 6 days left in Italy before I fly back to the states but we’ll be constantly moving (with our last stop in Venice). Does anyone have experience with the lost & found at Fiumicino airport? Any advice will be much appreciated. Thank you!
Is it possible to do Venice as a day trip from either Milan or Florence?

comments.comment_text: Milan 2 hour train ride
Anything is possible. It’s all about your expectations. From Milan it’s about a two hour and 10 minute train ride.
Absolutely. We drove from bondone and had a fabulous day in Venice
Don’t do a day trip to Venice stay at least one night minimum. Venice is a different vibe after the hoards of day tourists leave.
Venice in the evening is magical and you’ll miss it if you leave early.
Doable but not ideal. Spend 1 night in Venice if possible. So much better after dark. Still plenty of people but a lot better after the day trippers leave
It' s possible! But what do you see about? Neither Venice, Milan, or Florence. You need live Venice slowly, walking around, enjoy its beauty.

Yes it’s possible …! Trained up from
Florence and had Venice conquered in 9 hours!!

Why even bother?????
I suppose you’re the one who will be spending 3 days in Pisa?????
Venezia deserves at least 3 nights. You can do a day trip from Milano, but you won’t enjoy the city much unless your goal is to take a photo and turn around

We did
It on a day trip from Milan. It was still beautiful but I guess 2-3 days would be ideal

I've done Venice as a day trip from Milan once. I don't recommend it but it can be done. It makes for a very long day and you arrive after the tourists are flooding the streets. If possible, spend a night and get up early to beat the crowds.
2.5 hours each way from Florence or Milan with high speed train. Truthfully though…I’d skip Milan and spend the night in Venice if possible with your available time
Yes
Yes.....early train to Venezia Santa Lucia and late train out. Station is right on Grand Canal. Enjoy
Venice was easily our favorite city. Stay much much longer and soak up all its goodness.

If possible, stay in Venice a couple of nights, it’s worth it. I’ve been before and stayed and truly loved it. The beauty of staying is getting up early before the crowds arrive and wandering the beautiful streets, same with late afternoon when the crowds disperse. I went back for a day trip from Verona last time in Italy and the experience was very different. I found it overwhelming and not so great. Enjoy your trip 😊🥂🇮🇹
Made a wonderful day trip to Venice from Milan.😊
Definitely from Florence
Venice is magical city I spent 3 nights in it was not enough 😍😍😍
Dunia Aldyni
Dunia Aldyni

Yes we just did a day trip to Venice from Milan
Took train at 830 am from Milan and train back at 730 pm from Venice

After a 3 hour drive, we arrived in Venice at 11am, strolled through the streets, had pizza at a cafe called Farini at 12.30pm, walked to the ferry terminal to catch the ferry to the colourful island called Burano around 2.30pm, strolled around Burano and caught the 4.30 ferry back to Venice, saw Venice by night, had pizza again 😁 and drove away at 8pm. It didn’t feel rushed, but of course more time there would’ve been great. But we absolutely loved it. Enjoy
Absolutely
Do Venice for at least 2 full days
Yes, we took the train at 7am and went back to Florence around 7:30pm. With the fastest train we did it in 1h50m each way.
No
Stay a night or 2 in Venice from Milan

text: I always see people saying they end up shopping more than they expected. My question is about standard sizes stores carry around Italy. Are there plus sizes in stores? Or should I expect not to find anything larger?

Generally up to xxl, sometimes 3xl. This is the most common case. Also, depending on where you are from, note that there may not be perfect correspondence,
an xxl in Europe is often smaller than the xxl in the u.s.

text: Hi Everyone. I am just about to book my train tickets for my trip. What are your favourite booking sites and when choosing seats where is the best place to sit? 😊

Buy direct:
Trainline App, works great. We chose two window seats, that way one person is facing forward and the other backward. I don’t mind either but some people feel sick.

https://
www.omio.com/
travel/italy

Anonymous participant I booked on the Italo app . As for seats , I picked 2 seats across from each other because one person will at some point be riding facing backwards.

I booked online via Trenitalia. Their trains are awesome! Trentitalia, I have always used them, easy to navigate. Some prices worth booking in advance, others are very similar if booked on the day.

Trainline app first Or Trenitalia

text: Hi! My husband and I are planning a trip to Italy with our baby who will be 10 months old in April/May 2024 and definitely visiting Venice and Rome. Just looking for suggestions on where else we should add in for 2-3 nights either in between them or not too much of a detour as we’ll be travelling Germany and Austria before. We’re considering somewhere like Lake Como or Tuscany/wine regions but not sure what is best with bub and want easy transport by train where possible. Thanks so much :)

Thanks to this group for information as we planned our trip. At Rome airport now waiting to head home. Here is Rome info. I will post on Florence separately.

Rome:
So much busier than 2018 when last there. Also so much dirtier. Sad to see number of tourists leaving garbage on ground and window ledges. The city needs to step up litter clean up to help. That said we knew it would be busy and planned to visit other sites and we had great luck and really enjoyed:

Palazzo Doria Pamphilij on via del Corso beautiful private small palace. Get the audio guide! No advance tickets needed.

Palacio Colonna - another private palace. Only open Friday and Saturday mornings. Get ticket with garden. Stunning.

Musuem of Baths of Diocletian - great musuem. Not busy at all but not well air conditioned.

Spada gallery we found, it’s small but only 6 euros. It was fine for the price.

National Gallery of Ancient Art at Barberini Palace. Stunning also and no advance ticket needed.

Did an online self pace walking tour of Trastevere and had a great time exploring side streets, seeing makers of the homes of lost Jewish families and visiting some quiet churches.

We did pre-book the early morning Vatican tour that included a breakfast in the garden and that was awesome.

No issue with Uber which ordered you a taxi.
Also grabbed scooters that are all over city to rent.

Eating: do not eat at La Canonica in trastevere. It is a factory and food is on par with Olive Garden, nothing special.

Mimi e Coco for drinks and a meat and cheese platter in Trastevere was a great experience.

Really enjoyed a casual meal at Ai Balestrari, the suppli were really good and great pizza.

text: How would you compare Ostia Antica with Pompeii.

comments.comment_text:
Google says :
If you aren't going to visit Pompeii or Herculaneum, then Ostia Antica is an archaeological site well worth visiting in which it is possible to imagine how the city's inhabitants lived centuries ago. However, compared to Pompeii or Herculaneum, it is less impressive and less well preserved.
Each place is entirely different. Cannot compare.
Actually I have visited both Pompeii and Herculeum last year. Want to know how Ostia Antica compares and whether it is worth visiting when in Rome this year
Mud vs. Pyroclastic surge

We loved Ostia Antica! It is way less crowded so you have plenty of time to explore as you want. They have some beautiful mosaic floors and you get to climb up to the 2nd and 3rd floors in some areas.

We had a more enjoyable experience at Ostia Antica. When we were there, there was a constant breeze blowing which was nice. There were many areas at Pompeii that we were hoping to visit that were closed off due to excavation. That probably was a significant reason that we preferred Ostia Antica.
Both are good, but Pompeii is definitely the first choice. Ostia is the next best option.
Loved Ostia!

They are all very different but contemporaries.
Pompeii was buried in ash, Herculano is lava and Ostia Antica was basically abandoned when the river silted in and it couldn’t be used as a port anymore. Pompeii is huge, Ostia, not quite as large and Herculano is the smallest. They are all interesting. It really depends upon how much time you have. If you are in the Naples area, I think the contrast between Pompeii and Herculano is very interesting, but don’t forget to visit the archeological museum in Naples to see all of the artifacts from Pompeii.
Ostia is an easy train ride from Rome and is a pleasant place to spend an afternoon. It does have some shade which is nice when the weather is hot and as it isn’t as well known, it tends to be less crowded.
Look at Untold Italy's website and listen to podcasts. They feel Ostia is better for several reasons. We changed our plans to Ostia instead of Pompeii.
Thanks all for your inputs
After Ostia Antica, you can go to the beach at Ostia Lido (some extra stops after Ostia Antica). Not the most beautiful beach, but large beach and nice restaurants.
